algorithm_technique: finding four extreme values in one pass
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest product difference between two pairs of numbers in an array.
problem_summary_technical: Identify the two largest and two smallest numbers in a single pass to maximize (largest1 * largest2) - (smallest1 * smallest2).
key_insights: To maximize the difference (a*b) - (c*d), we need to maximize (a*b) and minimize (c*d).
This means selecting the two largest numbers for (a, b) and the two smallest for (c, d).
A single pass can track the two largest and two smallest elements efficiently.
